metadata.title: Colloidal Template Synthesis of Nanomaterials Using Microporous Organic Nanoparticles: The Case of C@MoS2 Nanoadsorbents
metadata.abstractText: A synthetic method, so-called colloidal template synthesis was applied for the preparation of surface-engineered nanoadsorbents. Colloidal microporous organic network nanotemplates (C-MONs) were prepared through the networking of organic building blocks in the presence of poly(vinylpyrrolidone), showing a high surface area of 611 m/g and microporosity. Due to the surface PVPs entrapped in networks, the C-MONs showed good colloidal dispersion in ethanol. The MoS2 precursors were incorporated into the C-MONs and heat-treatment resulted in coreshell type C@MoS2 nanoparticles with a diameter of 80 nm, a negative zeta potential (-39.5 mV), a high surface area of 508 m/g, and excellent adsorption performance (qmax of 343.6 mg/g and 421.9 mg/g for Methylene Blue and Rhodamine B, respectively) towards cationic dyes.
